name: yaw
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If an aircraft or ship yaws, it moves slightly to the side of its intended direction: The boat pitched and yawed in the bay. Witnesses to the crash reported seeing the Challenger yaw to the right.
More examplesFewer examplesThe small jet yawed sharply to the right.When rudder is applied, the nose of the glider yaws to the side.If the vertical stabilizer came off in flight, it could have caused the plane to suddenly yaw.

a slight movement of an aircraft or ship, to the side of its intended direction: The rudder is a vertical flap on the tail that controls yaw. I felt a slight pitch and yaw, like a hiccup in the floor beneath me.
More examplesFewer examplesThe wheels control the ship's pitch, the pedals its yaw.Electronic stability control senses yaw, wheel spin, and skid.The leftward yaw was caused by loss of thrust from the left engines.
